High Priority.citation: In this Agreement, 'Representatives' shall mean, with respect to any specified person, all of such person's subsidiaries and its and their respective directors, agents, representatives, employees, officers, management and advisors (including financial advisors, counsels, accountants and potential financiers).
High Priority.problem: The definition of 'Representatives' is too narrow. It must be expanded to include affiliates, shareholders, and potential syndicate members to allow for proper evaluation of the Proposed Transaction.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: Information may be disclosed by you to your affiliates and your and their respective directors, officers, employees, consultants, advisers, shareholders, potential syndicate members, agents, representatives, and other providers of financing (collectively, 'Representatives'), who need to know such Information for your evaluation of the Proposed Transaction, provided that you shall be responsible for any breach of this Agreement by your Representatives.

High Priority.citation: ...immediately return (or cause to be returned) or, at your discretion, destroy (or cause to be destroyed), all copies of the Information in your possession and in the possession of your Representatives...
High Priority.problem: The clause mandates the absolute destruction of Information upon request, without the required exceptions for information stored on automated backup systems or contained within internal work product ('Secondary Information').
High Priority.suggested_replacement: Upon the Company's written request, you shall return or destroy all Information. However, this obligation shall not apply to: (i) Information that you or your Representatives must retain under any applicable law, rule or regulation; (ii) Information and elaborations thereof as have been saved to electronic carriers under automatic archiving or data security procedures; and (iii) reports, notes or other materials prepared by or on behalf of you which incorporate Information ('Secondary Information'). Any Information or Secondary Information that is not returned or destroyed shall remain subject to the confidentiality terms of this Agreement.

High Priority.citation: You confirm that you are acting as principal and not as an agent or as part of a syndicate and that you will notify the Company in the event that you commence to work with any other potential investor...
High Priority.problem: This clause explicitly prohibits acting as part of a syndicate, which is unacceptable as it restricts the ability to form a consortium for the Proposed Transaction. This clause must be deleted.

High Priority.citation: ...you shall not, directly or indirectly, alone or together with any other persons or Affiliates... hire, employ, solicit the employment or endeavour to solicit or entice away from... any person who is or becomes an employee, director, trade representative, manager, consultant...
High Priority.problem: The non-solicitation clause is overly broad. It improperly applies to your Affiliates and lacks the mandatory exceptions for hiring individuals who respond to general advertisements or make unsolicited applications.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: For a period of two (2) years from the date of this Agreement, you agree not to directly solicit for employment any employee of the Company with whom you had material contact in connection with the Proposed Transaction. This restriction shall not apply to any of your affiliated portfolio companies, nor shall it apply to employees who respond to general public advertisements, make an unsolicited application for employment, are referred by a third-party recruiter who was not instructed to target the Company's employees, or whose employment was terminated by the Company.

High Priority.citation: ...you shall pay to the Company a lump -- sum compensation (forfaitaire schadevergoeding) of EUR 50.000, to be increased by EUR 1.000 for each day, or part of a day, that such infringement continues...
High Priority.problem: This clause imposes a prohibited penalty or liquidated damages amount for a breach. Liability must be limited to proven, direct damages only, and indirect or consequential damages must be excluded.
High Priority.suggested_replacement: Liability for a breach of this Agreement shall be limited to proven, direct damages. In no event shall either party be liable for any indirect, consequential, special, punitive, or incidental damages, or for any loss of profits, revenue, or data.

Medium Priority.citation: ...contact or hold discussions with any director, employee, self-employed service provider, agent, supplier, customer or consultant of the Company, except for those contacts made in the ordinary course of business, unconnected with the Proposed Transaction...
Medium Priority.problem: The no-contact clause is overly broad. It must be narrowed to apply only to directors, officers, or employees of the Company in connection with the Proposed Transaction, not all stakeholders like suppliers and customers.
Medium Priority.suggested_replacement: Without the prior written consent of the Company, you agree not to contact any directors, officers, or employees of the Company in connection with the Proposed Transaction. This restriction shall not be breached by any contact made for another purpose than the purpose of evaluating and negotiating the Proposed Transaction.

Medium Priority.citation: Any assignment of this Agreement by you without the prior written consent of the Company (which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed) shall be void.
Medium Priority.problem: The agreement includes a one-sided restriction on assignment. The ability to assign rights and obligations should be mutual to allow for assignment to affiliates.
Medium Priority.suggested_replacement: Each party may assign or transfer its rights and obligations under this Agreement to any of its affiliates without the prior written consent of the other party.

Low Priority.citation: ...you shall, without prejudice to any right of the Sellers or the Company, be responsible for any breach of confidentiality under this Agreement by your Representatives (as if they had signed this Agreement).
Low Priority.problem: The agreement imposes strict liability for breaches by your Representatives. This should be softened to an efforts-based standard.
Low Priority.suggested_replacement: You will use your best efforts to procure that each of your Representatives who receives any Information is aware of and adheres to the terms of this Agreement. You shall be responsible for any breach of the confidentiality obligations of this Agreement by your Representatives.

Low Priority.citation: The term Information shall not include such portions of Information which you can show: (a) are or become generally available to the public... (b) are lawfully in your possession... (c) is independently developed by you without violating this Agreement.
Low Priority.problem: The exceptions to the definition of 'Information' are incomplete. A standard exception for information disclosed with the written permission of the Company is missing.
Low Priority.suggested_replacement: Information does not include information that: (a) is or becomes generally available to the public through no breach by you of the confidentiality undertakings hereunder; (b) was in your lawful possession before receipt from the Company or the Sellers; (c) was received in good faith by you from a third party that is not subject to an obligation of confidentiality owed to the Company or the Sellers; or (d) was disclosed by you pursuant to the written permission of a duly authorized representative of the Company.

Low Priority.citation: Such confidentiality obligations shall survive termination of this Agreement for a period of three (3) years, without prejudice to any longer term which may apply to trade secrets and intellectual property rights.
Low Priority.problem: The confidentiality term of three years is the maximum acceptable. The preferred term is two years.
Low Priority.suggested_replacement: Such confidentiality obligations shall survive termination of this Agreement for a period of two (2) years.

processed_findings.problem: The definition of 'Representatives' is too narrow. It must be expanded to include affiliates, shareholders, and potential syndicate members to allow for proper evaluation of the Proposed Transaction.
processed_findings.citation: In this Agreement, "Representatives" shall mean, with respect to any specified person, all of such person's subsidiaries and its and their respective directors, agents, representatives, employees, officers, management and advisors (including financial advisors, counsels, accountants and potential financiers).
processed_findings.suggested_replacement: In this Agreement, "Representatives" shall mean, with respect to any specified person, all of such person's Affiliates and its and their respective directors, agents, representatives, employees, officers, management, shareholders, potential syndicate members and advisors (including financial advisors, counsels, accountants and potential financiers).

processed_findings.problem: The clause mandates the absolute destruction of Information upon request, without the required exceptions for information stored on automated backup systems or contained within internal work product ('Secondary Information').
processed_findings.citation: You agree that you will upon the Company’s written request, at any time, immediately return (or cause to be returned) or, at your discretion, destroy (or cause to be destroyed), all copies of the Information in your possession and in the possession of your Representatives (including but not limited to all documents, memoranda, notes and other writings -regardless of the medium used- and any other recordings or duplications thereof (including all copies, extracts or other reproductions) prepared by or on behalf of you that reproduce or incorporate portions of information contained in the Information).
processed_findings.suggested_replacement: You agree that upon the Company’s written request, you will promptly return or destroy all Information in your possession and in the possession of your Representatives; provided, however, that this obligation shall not apply to: (i) Information required to be retained by you or your Representatives under applicable law or regulation; (ii) analyses, compilations, studies, or other documents prepared by or on behalf of you or your Representatives which contain or otherwise reflect Information; and (iii) Information residing on automated backup or archival systems. Any Information so retained shall remain subject to the confidentiality obligations of this Agreement.

processed_findings.problem: This clause explicitly prohibits acting as part of a syndicate, which is unacceptable as it restricts the ability to form a consortium for the Proposed Transaction. This clause must be deleted.
processed_findings.citation: You confirm that you are acting as principal and not as an agent or as part of a syndicate and that you will notify the Company in the event that you commence to work with any other potential investor in connection with the Proposed Transaction.

processed_findings.problem: The non-solicitation clause is overly broad. It improperly applies to your Affiliates and lacks the mandatory exceptions for hiring individuals who respond to general advertisements or make unsolicited applications.
processed_findings.citation: you shall not, directly or indirectly, alone or together with any other persons or Affiliates, on your own account or in conjunction with, through or on behalf of any persons, agents, intermediaries, joint ventures or alliances, whether as manager, director, shareholder, consultant, subcontractor, employee or in any other capacity: hire, employ, solicit the employment or endeavour to solicit or entice away from or discourage from being employed or hired by the Company, at any time during the Non-Solicitation Period, (i) any person who is or becomes an employee, director, trade representative, manager, consultant, independent contractor or sub-contractor of the Company or (ii)  any former employee, director, trade representative, manager, consultant, independent contractor or sub-contractor of the Company whose employment relationship with the Company has at that moment been terminated less than six (6) months ago.
processed_findings.suggested_replacement: you shall not, directly or indirectly, solicit for employment any employee of the Company with whom you had material contact in connection with the Proposed Transaction; provided that this restriction shall not prohibit you from: (i) making general solicitations to the public not specifically targeted at employees of the Company, or (ii) hiring any individual who responds to such a general solicitation, makes an unsolicited application for employment, is referred by a third-party recruiter who was not instructed to target employees of the Company, or whose employment with the Company has been terminated.

processed_findings.problem: This clause imposes a prohibited penalty or liquidated damages amount for a breach. Liability must be limited to proven, direct damages only, and indirect or consequential damages must be excluded.
processed_findings.citation: In case of a breach of any clause of this Agreement, you shall pay to the Company a lump – sum compensation (forfaitaire schadevergoeding) of EUR 50.000,  to be increased by EUR 1.000 for each day, or part of a day, that such infringement continues after the first day of infringement without prejudice to the Company’s right to claim additional damages, if it can establish that it has incurred losses exceeding this amount.
processed_findings.suggested_replacement: A party’s liability arising from a breach of this Agreement shall be limited to proven, direct damages. In no event shall either party be liable for any indirect, consequential, special, punitive, or incidental damages, or for any loss of profits, revenue, or data.

processed_findings.problem: The no-contact clause is overly broad. It must be narrowed to apply only to directors, officers, or employees of the Company in connection with the Proposed Transaction, not all stakeholders like suppliers and customers.
processed_findings.citation: You will not and shall procure that none of your Representatives will contact or hold discussions with any director, employee, self-employed service provider, agent, supplier, customer or consultant of the Company, except for those contacts made in the ordinary course of business, unconnected with the Proposed Transaction and not involving any use or disclosure of Information.
processed_findings.suggested_replacement: You will not and shall procure that none of your Representatives will contact or hold discussions with any director, officer, or employee of the Company in connection with the Proposed Transaction, provided that this restriction shall not apply to any contacts made in the ordinary course of business for purposes unconnected with the Proposed Transaction.

processed_findings.problem: The agreement includes a one-sided restriction on assignment. The ability to assign rights and obligations should be mutual to allow for assignment to affiliates.
processed_findings.citation: Any assignment of this Agreement by you without the prior written consent of the Company (which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed) shall be void.
processed_findings.suggested_replacement: Neither party may assign this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other party, which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed; provided, however, that either party may assign this Agreement to any of its Affiliates without such consent.

processed_findings.problem: The agreement imposes strict liability for breaches by your Representatives. This should be softened to an efforts-based standard.
processed_findings.citation: you shall, without prejudice to any right of the Sellers or the Company, be responsible for any breach of confidentiality under this Agreement by your Representatives (as if they had signed this Agreement)
processed_findings.suggested_replacement: you shall use best efforts to ensure your Representatives comply with the terms of this Agreement and you shall be responsible for any breach of this Agreement by your Representatives

processed_findings.problem: The exceptions to the definition of 'Information' are incomplete. A standard exception for information disclosed with the written permission of the Company is missing.
processed_findings.citation: The term Information shall not include such portions of Information which you can show: (a) are or become generally available to the public other than as a result of a disclosure or other default by you or by your Representatives; (b) are lawfully in your possession or become available to you from a source, other than the Company or the Sellers or any of their Representatives, which is not prohibited from disclosing such portions to you by a contractual, legal or fiduciary obligation; or (c) is independently developed by you without violating this Agreement.
processed_findings.suggested_replacement: The term Information shall not include such portions of Information which you can show: (a) are or become generally available to the public other than as a result of a disclosure or other default by you or by your Representatives; (b) are lawfully in your possession or become available to you from a source, other than the Company or the Sellers or any of their Representatives, which is not prohibited from disclosing such portions to you by a contractual, legal or fiduciary obligation; (c) is independently developed by you without violating this Agreement; or (d) is disclosed with the prior written consent of the Company.

processed_findings.problem: The confidentiality term of three years is the maximum acceptable. The preferred term is two years.
processed_findings.citation: Such confidentiality obligations shall survive termination of this Agreement for a period of three (3) years, without prejudice to any longer term which may apply to trade secrets and intellectual property rights.
processed_findings.suggested_replacement: Such confidentiality obligations shall survive termination of this Agreement for a period of two (2) years, without prejudice to any longer term which may apply to trade secrets and intellectual property rights.
